DataElement.preferredName: Non-Protocol Specified Intervention or Procedure Performed  Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The reason an action, intervention, or procedure was used to diagnose or treat the course of a pathologic process that was not specified in a protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non-Protocol Specified Intervention or Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to an action, intervention, or procedure used to diagnose or treat the course of a pathologic process that was not specified in a protocol being performed

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.:Specified; clearly and explicitly stated.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Concepts.definition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to NRG for by script Fri Jan 24 11:30:54 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The reason a non-protocol specified procedure was performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In medicine, something that prevents or protects.

Concepts.definition: Any intervention to prevent disease or infection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
